description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1c33i","text":"Preservation of samples requiring cold-chain storage is an often unavoidable challenge especially when doing laboratory work outside the western world. Samples are a precious commodity and it is imperative to maintain their viability. One method for collection and storage of samples in a liquid form (blood, saliva, serum) at room temperature is on filter paper cards like the Cellabs Tropbio Filter Paper Blood Collection Disks™. Methods and protocols exist for the use and recovery of whole blood from filter paper discs. This protocol describes the wash and recovery of DNA extracted from whole blood using the Qiagen DNeasy Extraction kit and dried on filter paper, re-suspended after several months of room temperature storage and use in conventional PCR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"kcse","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"22l9b","text":"This protocol was used to suspend DNA extracted from the wholeblood of Dogs in Cairo, Egypt. The DNA was extracted using the Qiagen DNEasy Extraction Kit and placed on Cellabs Tropbio Filter Paper Blood Collection Disks™ (filter paper). The DNA dried on the filter paper overnight and was stored in plastic self-closure baggies for several months before being washed off and used in Conventional PCR. The use case described here is of a dog who was PCR positive for Babesia spp.  using a sample of whole blood washed from the filter paper as well as dried DNA from filter paper. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":466,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: DNA Extraction,Egypt,Field work,Tropbio filter paper,room temperature DNA storage

{"blocks":[{"key":"4blr9","text":"The DNA is recovered at the final step of the extraction process when buffer 'AE' is used. Take care not to accidentally discard the flow-thru of this step, the AE wash product contains the actual DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v2ab","text":"Wear clean gloves and remove individual filter paper disk with 'ears' (each Cellabs Tropbio Filter Paper Blood Collection Disks™- Disk has 6 individual ears attached to it) from the sheet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"55lvj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bmblk","text":"Filter paper will need a clean, dry, flat area to dry   after application of the DNA extract, ensure an appropriate bench space is prepared before removing Filter Paper from packaging.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f63jo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"E643C4E0B84411EBB820C5CA95747E85","id":"80815","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mo94","text":"use a sharpie or other permanent marker to write your sample ID on the center part of the disk","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqqua","text":"if extract is not already at room temperature, bring the DNA extract to room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3idu7","text":"Vortex or invert microcentrifuge tube containing DNA extract for   to mix DNA evenly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"92git","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"323ig","text":"On each 'ear' of the filter paper disk, pipette   of DNA extract","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"753jl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"136F0830B84511EBB820C5CA95747E85","id":"80816","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"1D60A7E0B84511EBB820C5CA95747E85","id":"90345","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2g578","text":"Allow Filter Paper to dry  , or longer on a clean, dry, flat surface","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ca18c","text":"The remaining DNA in the microcentrifuge tube can be discarded or stored in a freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"2EA5E3D0B84511EBB820C5CA95747E85","id":"80817","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35ofd","text":"After drying overnight, dried filter paper can be placed individually in self-closing plastic bags and sealed tightly. The individual plastic bags can be stored in a larger self-closing plastic bag containing a pelleted desiccant to minimize the risk of moisture getting to the filter paper.      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":293,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":295,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9ch26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3DD5E430B6AC11EBA70F313BE2DC9050","height":309,"id":251987,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"gdui","text":"Dried filterpaper cards sealed in individual plastic bags","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"1740.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hycxbj66x.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hycvbj66x.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hycwbj66x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hycubj66x.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2F7200D0B6AD11EBA70F313BE2DC9050","height":733,"id":251991,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ufsu","text":"Dried filter paper stored in individual plastic bags with silica","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"20200307_111242.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hyc3bj66x.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hyczbj66x.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hyc2bj66x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hycybj66x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3unel","text":"DNA on filter paper can be stored at room temperature for up to 6 months","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4908f","text":"10mM Tris-HCL, pH 8.5 is used to wash dried DNA from filter paper.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0o59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abp3g","text":"To make 500 mL 10mM Tris-HCL, pH 8.5 wash do the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":426466,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Tris base","linfor":"","url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/t1503?lang=en\u0026region=GB","sku":"T1503","cas_number":"77-86-1","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F4838AD0E6C511EC98B1552311FA6BC9","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":17,"name":"Sigma Aldrich","link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3p0ql","text":"to make 500mL 10mM Tris-HCL, pH 8.5 (Starting with 121.1 g/mol tris powder)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"29oj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dt8i","text":"measure 0.6055 g tris base powder and pour into a sterile glass bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"alj8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fvdb","text":"add about 300mL DI water to the bottle with the tris base powder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cplas","text":"Use a pH meter to adjust the pH of the tris base in water until a pH of 8.5 is achieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eav0u","text":"Once the appropriate pH is achieved, add DI water to bring total volume to 500mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fdft4","text":"Loosely place a cap on the glass bottle containing the tris base and autoclave it on settings appropriate for your machine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare to wash DNA from Filter Paper - make Tris-HCL
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcd01","text":"Allow tris base to cool to room temperature following completion of autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0lbf","text":"In a clean, sterile 2mL microcentrifuge tube, place one whole filter paper 'ear' containing dried DNA extract. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v9h6","text":"Pipette 150µL of sterile Tris HCL @pH 8.5 (made in step 7 above) into the microcentrifuge tube containing the filter paper 'ear'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6dhk6","text":"ensure the filter paper ear is completely submerged in the liquid, close lid, vortex thoroughly for 20 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l1cq","text":"Ensure the filter paper ear is submerged following vortex, with lid closed, place tube on rocking platform at 4C, 500rpm for 2 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9c1ja","text":"following 2 hours of rocking, the DNA will be suspended in the eluate in the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6gome","text":"Prepare a clean and sterile bench space for PCR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95dm","text":"Prepare mastermix following the protocol for the  QiagenTaq PCR Master Mix Kit (Catalog #201445).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":56,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"otg5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"835bn","text":"MasterMix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bcgb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78oji","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d9bpc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rm60","text":"thaw (if necessary) and  vortex the microcentrifuge tube with the washed DNA Sample before adding it to the mastermix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aoeu0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uhad","text":"use 10µL of the washed DNA (from step 9 of this protocol) as the 'sample' in the mastermix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":950992,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Taq PCR Master Mix MasterMix","50 µL"],["Forward Primer","3µL"],["Reverse Primer","3µL"],["Sample (washed DNA from step 8)","10µL"],["Water","34µL"],["Total","100 µL"]],"guid":"A9C08D40B6B011EBA70F313BE2DC9050","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Qiagen MasterMix","50 µL"],["Forward Primer","3µL"],["Reverse Primer","3µL"],["Sample (washed DNA from step 8)","10µL"],["Water","34µL"],["Total","100 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7g7qn","text":"Thermal Cycle ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aijaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ckv6r","text":"lid 105°C, 95°C 3min, 95°C 30sec, 60°C 30 sec 72°C 45sec, repeat 34x, 72°C 10min, 4°C infinite hold or placed in 4°C refrigerator until gel electrophoresis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
